title: Manager Risk Management
tagsAndSkills: SAP,Risk Management,Internal Audit,Process Automation,Automation,Telecommunication,Financial Control,Business Process Improvement
jobDescription:
OBJECTIVE:


Design and execute risk management process based on defined Group risk management framework to manage risk. The standard risk management process conducted as part of Day-to-Day Risk Management and Business and Strategic Risk Management covers setting business objectives, identifying risk events with their causes and consequences, assessing risks, implementing risk responses, monitoring and reporting risks.

--------------------------

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ ACCOUNTABILITIES:


1. Identify Key Risk Events

2. Conduct Risk Assessment

3. Identify of controls (Key and Standard)

4. Progress on the implementation of risk mitigating actions to reduce the risk

5. Monitoring and evaluation of key controls for design and operating effectiveness to manage the risk

6. Ensure Control self-assessment and functional assurance testing are completed as per plan

7. Review reports and submit summary report of compliance / progress.

8. Ensure the active participation in risk management awareness drive across organisation.

9. Drive implementation of various process improvement initiatives identified.

title: Company Secretary
tagsAndSkills: Company Secretarial,Meeting Planning,Filing,Company Secretarial Functions,Secretarial Activities,Governance,Secretarial Work,Functional
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

  • Managing and ensuring compliances of 4 or 5 Public Companies.
  • Ensure compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and guidelines.
  • Ensure filing of necessary statutory returns and forms within stipulated timelines.
  • Organize and facilitate board, committee and general meetings.
  • Draft agendas, minutes, and resolutions for meetings.
  • Liaise with board members and ensure effective communication.
  • Implement and maintain best practices in corporate governance.
  • Preparation of Annual report of the Company as per Companies Act, 2013.
  • Maintenance of records, registers, minutes of meeting and other important documents of the Company.
  • Co-ordination with Auditors, Practicing Company Secretaries, ROC, Consultants etc.
  • Handling compliances relating to rights issue.

title: Manager: Business Finance
tagsAndSkills: Financial Analysis,SAP,Telecom,Revenue Analysis,Budget Management,Cost Optimization,MIS Reporting,RFP
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities:

1. Evaluate RFPs and raise pre-bid queries to ensure clarity and accuracy.

2. Prepare business commercials for RFPs, aligning them with organizational goals.

3. Validate budget uploads in SAP to ensure accuracy and compliance.

4. Evaluate business cases post facto, analyze outcomes, and identify areas for improvement.

5. Validate lead-to-order cases, ensuring process integrity and adherence to guidelines.

6. Generate and distribute weekly Management Information System (MIS) reports to stakeholders.

7. Coordinate with internal auditors to efficiently address and close audit points.

8. Validate Purchase Requisitions (PR) in SAP for accuracy and compliance.

9. Review business cases approved by the Business Continuity Operations (BCO) team, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and standards.

10. Conduct detailed analyses of revenue, costs, CAPEX, and key KPIs, including collections, waivers, and customer acquisition tenders, to drive informed decision-making and optimize financial performance.

11. Facilitate coordination among teams to prepare the consolidated Annual Operating Plan (AOP), ensuring alignment of objectives and resources across the organization.

This position requires meticulous attention to detail, strong analytical skills, and effective communication abilities to ensure the smooth and efficient operation of business processes and compliance with internal policies and procedures.


Educational Qualifications:


CA

title: Market Data Admin (SME)
tagsAndSkills: Invoice reconciliation,MDM,Dax,Dax Queries,RPM,Reconciliation,Query,Data
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

  • Answer day to day non-technical queries on data usage rights by reviewing and understanding the contract along with what service it is providing to end users.
  • Manage the new vendor onboarding process along with conducting any due-diligence checks and system setup.
  • Leading a project to collate all vendor onboarding documentation.
  • Maintain the invoice and team email mailboxes and any post once back in the office.
  • File and maintain the physical and electronic copies of executed contracts, invoices and any other key documents.
  • Support the Data Stewards with any query regarding contract agreement and products information.
  • As part of the Data Transformation project, work on the implementation and enrichment of the data feeds including contract agreement identifiers, metadata related to vendor and contract information and work on the design of efficient contract management framework.
  • Run appropriate reports from DACS/MECS in order to facilitate appropriate cost sharing/allocations
  • Invoice reconciliation and cross-charging globally/cross-geographically
  • Data Access Declaration (DAD) preparation and processing of DAD. Check invoices considering DAD
  • Liaise with contract management and market data analysts, vendor and product management and MDS compliance group
  • Interaction with Finance Department, SAP, ordering process, etc.
  • Help to enforce Global Processes surrounding Market Data Management, i.e. quality and consistency of leavers, joiners, maternity, sickness, etc.
  • Management and reporting of all declarations as per compliance guidelines.
  • Administration/implementation of all data accesses.
  • Maintenance and ownership of the inventory management system (Market Data Manager; MDM) and all associated modules such as RPM (Request Process Manager).
  • Automate Market Data Management, including collation, reporting and processes wherever possible
  • Responsibility for understanding the commercial aspects of data notifications and associated cost allocations
  • Process requests using the Incident Management tool, or via email.
  • Provide reports for Audits

Preferred candidate profile


  • Relevant market data experience within a bank, financial services or a regulated environment.
  • Proficient in MS Office (Excel / Word / PowerPoint)
  • Good problem solving skills
  • Good analytical and numeracy skills
  • Good organizational and communication skills
  • Enjoys working in a close team environment
  • Customer and revenue focused approach
  • Self-motivated and able to work in a demanding environment
  • Able to work independently, multitask, set goals and priorities
  • A flexible approach and a willingness to take on more responsibilities
  • Takes ownership of any issues that come up and facilitates their resolution quickly using own initiative while managing expectations.
  • Comfortable interacting with all teams & building a rapport.

Perks and benefits


Permanent Role

Hybrid Shift

title: Compliance Officer
tagsAndSkills: Compliance,It Compliance,Compliance Officer
jobDescription:
Job Responsibilities -


Core Compliance • Ensuring that the Bank is in Compliance with the relevant guidelines issued by RBI and other regulators including advisory and alerts issued by the CSITE team. • Review new products, procedures, system implementation to ensure activities of the bank are compliant with all the regulatory and statutory requirements including the internal procedures, processes and policies laid down by the Board. • Carry out Compliance testing as per the approved compliance testing plan including regular tracking for observed gaps, if any. Some of the areas to be covered in testing are: Change & Incident Management, Effectiveness of cyber controls, IT vendor outsourcing, secure application development life cycle, CMDB for Infrastructure, Inventory Management, Patch Management, secure hardening, vulnerability management etc. • Provide consultation / timely clarifications on various regulatory matters within the organization in respect of assigned functional areas. • Interaction with the regulator for various clarifications required, dissemination and tracking the same.


Risk Based Supervision • Understanding the regulatory requirements under Risk Based Supervision (RBS) / CSITE inspection and providing support to the concerned units heads in Compliance • Data Reviews for various Tranche submissions to the regulator from time to time including Compliance testing. • Monitor that timely and comprehensive actions are taken by respective functions to ensure compliance with the observations in regulatory / statutory inspection reports.

title: Cyber Security Engineer- Vulnerability Management
tagsAndSkills: Tenable Security Centre,Vulnerability assessments,Vulnerability Management,Nessus,Qualys,CVE,Remediations Certifications like CEH,Vulnerability
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities :

We are looking for Individual contributor (Technical) role having ability to perform,

  • Vulnerability assessments for,
  • Servers Middleware.
  • Network Devices/Appliances.
  • Applications.
  • Endpoint systems.
  • Ensure compliance to Minimum Baseline Security Standards for servers, applications, databases, endpoints, and networks.
  • Assist in reviewing vulnerability data from multiple sources (i.e., vulnerability scanning, external / internal penetration testing, etc.) across multiple technologies and a changing environment including infrastructure and applications to determine risk rating of vulnerabilities to business assets.
  • Perform Risk Assessment and recommend appropriate controls.
  • Perform Penetration testing for the servers and network on a periodic/need basis.


Preferred candidate profile

  • Experience in one or more vulnerability scanning tools.
  • Excellent knowledge in Security Operations/Information Security Process, techniques, and technologies.
  • Provide recommendations for continuous improvements in Security Operations.
  • Deeper understanding of Patching, Vulnerability & Remediation.
  • Experience in management reporting and Metrics Reporting.
  • Knowledge on Minimum Baseline Security Standards and Industry best practices including NIST.
  • Knowledge of vulnerability scoring systems (CVSS/CVE)
  • Knowledge of Governance tools as well as automated and manual VAPT tools such as Nmap, Nessus, Kali, Burp suite etc.
  • Certifications like CEH or other information security or IT platform certifications.

Key Attributes:

  • Should be open to work in shifts, willing to learn new technologies cross skilling, Upskilling Good Communication presentation skills.
  • Strong Verbal and written communication skills.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in Vulnerability Assessment of Servers and Network Devices.

Graduate from a reputed/recognized institute.


Location: Ghansoli, Navi Mumbai

jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities

Experience working with an investment management or finance-related firm.

  • Knowledge of how the corporate action notification are send to clients.
  • Should have knowledge of various types of corporate action in market ( Bonus, Dividend, Right Issue etc..)
  • Should know what Mandatory and Voluntary Corporate Action is.
  • Able to understand the difference between Ex-date, Record Date & Payment.
  • Should have knowledge of Bloomberg, DTCC, Euroclear etc.
  • Should have Swift knowledge and how its works (MT564, MT568, MT566 etc.).
  • Should have knowledge of withholding tax and re-claims from vendors.
  • Proficiency in Excel functions. An ability to think critically and objectively.
  • Excellent communication and inter-personal skills.
  • Experience in performing Quality Audit checks for the team.
  • Work additional hours as needed.
  • Responding to queries in a timely manner with adequate research.
  • Experience in working with international clients across regions.

Preferred candidate profile

  • Knowledge of how the corporate action notification are send to clients.
  • Should have knowledge of various types of corporate action in market ( Bonus, Dividend, Right Issue)

Should know what Mandatory and Voluntary Corporate Action is.


Perks and benefits

  • Should understand the gaps and bridge them up. Should have a succession plan in-place.
  • Flexible in handling and managing new roles, teams and functions.
  • Should have done the yearly appraisal of team members and able to understand the Bell Curve of the company.
  • Excellent communication and inter-personal skills. Work additional hours as needed.
  • Experience in working with international clients across regions.

title: Business Development Executive
tagsAndSkills: Corporate Sales,B2B Marketing,Corporate Selling,B2B,Corporate Marketing,Business To Business,B2B Sales,Enterprise Sales
jobDescription:
Job Description
Company: Internet Service Provider
Year of Establishment: 1998
No. of Employees:185, Gujarat, Mumbai, Jaipur, Gurugram
Designation: Business Development Executive
Product & Services: Internet Leased Lines only, No Broadband
Experience: minimum 2 years into Direct Sales / Corporate Sales / HNI sales
Preferred Industry: Internet, Telecom, IT Enabled Services
Educational Qualification: Minimum Graduation
Job Location: Bestech Business Tower, Sohna Road, Gurugram

Job Summary:
The basic purpose of this role is to ensure the implementation of the sales and marketing strategy at the ground level

Job Details:

  1. To identify and create business opportunities in industry verticals and thereby promote Direct Sales/ B2B Sales / Corporate Sales.
  2. Generate new leads from various sources.
  3. Follow up on customer inquiry and leads generated.
  4. Responsible for ensuring exceptional Customer Service and Account Maintenance
  5. Attend to customer complaints immediately and try resolving them on priority basis and thereby retain them.
  6. Ensure new business development opportunities are explored with existing clients.
  7. Acquire complete/in-depth product knowledge of all products and services.
  8. Ensure timely maintenance of reports and feedback on status arising out of received leads.
  9. Number, value and income target achievement.


Qualities Required:

  1. Pleasant Personality
  2. Excellent Communication Skills (English)
  3. Aggressive Sales Experience in the past
  4. Willingness to travel for meetings
  5. Smart and should have ability to sell
  6. Travel across Mumbai for Closures and Business Deals


Job Type: Full-time

Salary: 25,000.00 - 35,000.00 per month

Benefits:

  • Yearly full salary bonus
  • Handsome Yearly appraisal
  • Cell phone (Sim) reimbursement
  • Conveyance
  • Paid sick time
  • Handsome Yearly appraisal


Schedule: Day shift, 6 Days

Ability to commute/relocate: Yes

Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience: Business Development: 2 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
